body_html:
the CUDA builds are seeing legit failures:

08:04:24 /opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/ATen/Half.h:10:18: fatal error: cuda.h: No such file or directory

when compiling the extension.
The problem exists on master, not specifically introduced in this PR.
A workaround seems to be: export CPATH=$CUDA_HOME/include:$CPATH. We should prob use https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/tools/setup_helpers/cuda.py to detect CUDA and if exists add the path to the extension's include paths as well.

body:
the CUDA builds are seeing legit failures:

```
08:04:24 /opt/conda/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/lib/include/ATen/Half.h:10:18: fatal error: cuda.h: No such file or directory
```
when compiling the extension.
The problem exists on master, not specifically introduced in this PR.
A workaround seems to be: `export CPATH=$CUDA_HOME/include:$CPATH`. We should prob use https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/tools/setup_helpers/cuda.py to detect CUDA and if exists add the path to the extension's include paths as well.
